intro: Bicornella sororia, commonly known as the twin-lobed spleenwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Peltaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as sporocarps, are borne on stalks and contain spores for dispersal. Bicornella sororia is an important indicator species for assessing the health of forest ecosystems.
